translation: On Friday, May 27, 2005, the 9 train of the New York City Subway made its final run, ending the rush hour skip-stop service north of the 137th Street-City College station on the IRT Broadway-Seventh Avenue Line.
reference_text: On Friday, May 27, 2005, 9 trains on the New York City Subway will make their final run, ending rush-hour skip-stop service on the IRT Broadway-Seventh Avenue Line north of 137th Street-City College.

justification: The translation is excellent. It accurately conveys the full meaning of the source text, including the negation of both deposits and withdrawals. The phrasing "deposit or withdrawal requests" is a natural and fluent way to handle 「預け入れも引き出しの要求も」. The word order and grammar are perfect. The only minor difference from the reference is "from Icesave internet accounts" vs. "through our Icesave internet accounts," but "from" is equally valid and arguably a more direct translation of the particle 「から」 in this context.
source_text: 「我々は現在、いかなる預け入れも引き出しの要求もアイスセーブのインターネット口座から処理していない。」
translation: "We are currently not processing any deposit or withdrawal requests from Icesave internet accounts."
reference_text: "We are not currently processing any deposits or any withdrawal requests through our Icesave internet accounts."

justification: The translation is highly accurate and fluent. It correctly captures the past tense of the verbs ("denied," "accused") from the source text. All components, including "such claims," "US government," and "anti-Iran sentiment," are translated appropriately. The resulting English sentence is natural and grammatically correct.
source_text: イランはそのような主張を否定し、米国政府がその地域で反イラン感情を広めようとしていると非難した。
translation: Iran denied such claims and accused the US government of trying to spread anti-Iran sentiment in the region.
reference_text: Iran denies such allegations and accuses Washington of trying to spread anti-Iranian sentiment in the region.

justification: The translation is highly accurate and fluent. It correctly conveys all the information from the source text. The phrasing "tried to force her off the road" is a perfect rendition of "道路から追いだそうとした". The rest of the sentence structure and vocabulary choices are natural and correct. It is of professional quality.
source_text: 警察はまた、自分の車を運転していたスピアーズを追う少なくとも1台の車が、彼女を道路から追いだそうとしたと言っているが、彼女はその車またはそれに乗っていた人物を特定できなかった。
translation: Police also say that at least one car, which was following Spears while she was driving her own car, tried to force her off the road, but she was unable to identify the car or the person in it.
reference_text: Police also say that at least one of cars following Spears, who was driving her car, tried to run her off the road, but she was not able to identify the vehicle or the occupants.

justification: The translation is very good but not perfect. It correctly translates all the entities and the main action. However, the Japanese word 「それぞれ」 (sorezore) in this context strongly implies a one-to-one correspondence: Lightning -> Germany, and Penguins -> Finland. The English word "respectively" captures this meaning precisely, as shown in the reference. The translation's use of "each" is slightly ambiguous; it could be interpreted as "each team will play games in both Germany and Finland," which is not the intended meaning. While the intended meaning can still be inferred, "respectively" is more accurate and less ambiguous.
source_text: ライトニングとペンギンスはそれぞれ、ドイツとフィンランドでエキシビジョン試合を行う。
translation: The Lightning and the Penguins will each play exhibition games in Germany and Finland.
reference_text: The Lightning and Penguins will play exhibition games in Germany and Finland respectively.

justification: The translation is excellent. It accurately conveys all the information from the source text. "Other labels, such as..." is a very natural and correct way to translate 「他には、〜といったレーベル」. The choice of "will showcase" for 「披露する」 is also perfectly idiomatic. The translation is grammatically flawless, fluent, and precise, making it indistinguishable from a professional human translation.
source_text: 他には、バッジリー・ミシュカやディーゼル、ヴィヴィアン・タムといったレーベルが火曜日にその最新コレクションを披露する。
translation: Other labels, such as Badgley Mischka, Diesel, and Vivienne Tam, will showcase their latest collections on Tuesday.
reference_text: Among others, labels Badgley Mischka, Diesel, and Vivienne Tam unveil their newest collections on Tuesday.

justification: The translation is excellent. "Under the scheme" is a perfectly valid and natural translation for 「その計画では」 in this financial context, just as "The plan" is. The use of "is covered" instead of "will cover" is a minor stylistic difference that accurately reflects the present-tense passive form 「カバーされ」 in the source. The structure and vocabulary are fluent and precise, making the translation indistinguishable from one produced by a professional human translator.
source_text: その計画では最初の2万887ユーロ（約1万6300ポンド／2万8720ドル）がカバーされ、顧客の資金の残りはイギリス自身の金融賠償システムを通じて回復される。
translation: Under the scheme, the first €20,887 (about £16,300 / $28,720) is covered, and the remainder of the customers' funds will be recovered through the UK's own financial compensation system.
reference_text: The plan will cover the first € 20,887 (Approx £16,300 / $28,720), the remainder of the customers funds being recovered through the UK's own financial compensation system.

justification: The translation is excellent. It accurately conveys the full meaning of the source text. All components are translated correctly: "世界中の" as "around the world," "イスラム教徒の権利" as "the rights of Muslims," "冒涜的映画" as "blasphemous film," and "侵害されている" as "are being violated." The resulting English sentence is perfectly fluent and grammatical. It is arguably even more natural than the provided reference translation ("blasphemous film" is more idiomatic than "blaspheming movie").
source_text: 「世界中のイスラム教徒の権利はこの冒涜的映画によって侵害されている。」
translation: "The rights of Muslims around the world are being violated by this blasphemous film."
reference_text: "The rights of Muslims all over the world are violated by this blaspheming movie."

justification: The translation is excellent. It accurately conveys all the information from the source text, including the entities (Radiopress, North Korea's official media, Kim Jong-il), the action (omitted the title), and the specific title ("Dear Leader"). The grammar and phrasing are perfectly natural and fluent in English. It is a professional-quality translation that is indistinguishable from a human one.
source_text: 水曜日に、北朝鮮の公式メディアは「親愛なる指導者」というキム・ジョンイルの尊称を省略したと、日本のラヂオプレスは報じました。
translation: On Wednesday, Japan's Radiopress reported that North Korea's official media omitted the honorific title "Dear Leader" for Kim Jong-il.
reference_text: On Wednesday North Korea's official media dropped Kim Jong Il's honourific title "Dear leader", reported Japan's Radiopress.
